title: Liverpool news: Jose Mourinho picks out Jurgen Klopp's major weakness after Man Utd draw
text:
Liverpool were not at their best in a 1-1 draw at Manchester United (Picture: Getty Images)

Jose Mourinho says Liverpool have ‘limitations against teams with low blocks’ after their below-par draw with Manchester United on Sunday at Old Trafford.

The Reds dropped points for the first time in the Premier League this season, needing a late Adam Lallana equaliser to take a point back from Manchester after Marcus Rashford opened the scoring.

The home side had the better of the match in the first half and looked set to hand the Reds their first defeat of the league season, before Lallana rose from the bench to secure a point.

Liverpool have not won at Old Trafford since 2014 and boss Jurgen Klopp explained after the match how his team find it difficult because Manchester United simply want to defend against them.

Mourinho agrees with this assessment, describing United’s defensive outlook as a ‘low block’ and saying Liverpool’s failure to break it down is a major weakness.

Advertisement

‘Their quality as a team to play against a low block, which is a problem that sometimes they have,’ Mourinho said on Sky Sports.

”They have these fantastic records of all these victories, but they have some limitations against teams with low blocks.

‘Jurgen clearly has a little bit of frustration, they are a fantastic team, but at Old Trafford, a special place for Liverpool to win, he never did it.’

Jurgen Klopp showed his frustration at Old Trafford (Picture: Getty Images)

On Klopp’s frustrations over the way United play against his team, Mourinho was dismissive, saying: ‘He didn’t like the menu, he likes meat and he got fish.’

Former Liverpool player and manager Graeme Souness agreed with the Portuguese that the Reds can lack the creativity to break down teams that are largely playing to frustrate them.

While the Reds’ first choice front three, Mo Salah [who missed Sunday’s game through injury], Sadio Mane and Roberto Firmino cause serious problems, the midfield of Fabinho, Jordan Henderson and Georginio Wijnaldum are less concerning for opposition defences.

‘Liverpool suffered because they have a midfield that can out-work anyone but today they got out-worked,’ Souness said on Sky Sports.

‘When they get into the opposition’s third they haven’t got that cuteness, they have got workaholics, but no one who can pay that cute pass.’

Advertisement

The Reds will be hoping Salah will make a swift return from his ankle injury in swift fashion as they look to get their creative spark back.

The Egyptian is out with an ankle problem, but Klopp is hopeful he will be back for Wednesday’s trip to Genk in the Champions League.

‘Mo was not ready so that’s how it is,’ Klopp said before the game at Old Trafford. ‘He couldn’t train with the team, I don’t where it came from that everybody said he will play, there was pretty much no chance for today, but maybe for Wednesday, we will see.’

Liverpool remain top of the table, six points clear of Manchester City who got back to winning ways on Saturday, winning 2-0 at Crystal Palace.
